ITEM.NAME: .cdsinit
ITEM.DESC: File that defines the startup environment of the Cadence software

ITEM.NAME: AMSD
ITEM.DESC: Virtuoso AMS Designer

ITEM.NAME: assistant menu
ITEM.DESC: Menu that appears at the top of an assistant pane in a window of the Virtuoso software. This menu differs from a banner menu which appears at the top of a session window.

ITEM.NAME: assistant pane
ITEM.DESC: Dockable workspace component, which can have an assistant toolbar and an assistant menu bar, in a window of the Virtuoso software.

ITEM.NAME: assistant toolbar
ITEM.DESC: Toolbar that appears at the top of an assistant pane in a window of the Virtuoso software. This toolbar differs from a banner toolbar that appears near the top of a session window.

ITEM.NAME: BBT
ITEM.DESC: (Building Block Text) Instances added to a design to create a model schematic. Helps in defining the model behavior and obtaining a graphical representation of the behavioral model.

ITEM.NAME: bindkey
ITEM.DESC: Keyboard key or mouse button linked (bound) to a Virtuoso SKILL command or function name.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: BJT
ITEM.DESC: Bipolar Junction Transistor
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: CDF
ITEM.DESC: (Component Description Format) Assigns attributes, properties, and parameters to libraries and cells for such purposes as assigning parameter names and values, allocating units and default values, checking that values lie within specified ranges, dynamically changing how parameters are displayed depending on predefined conditions, and executing Cadenceï¿½ SKILL programming language functions whenever certain information is changed (callback functions). A cell CDF lets you store information specific to a cell with that cell. For more information, see the Component Description Format User Guide.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: Cell Name
ITEM.DESC: Name assigned to the cellview as it is defined in the SKILL file.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: Cellview-Based Netlister
ITEM.DESC: Creates a Verilog-AMS netlist for one cell at a time in the lib/cell/view for the cell. If you use the cellview-based netlister, you must add ams simInfo to your library.

ITEM.NAME: CIW
ITEM.DESC: (Command Interpreter Window) Window that launches any Virtuoso Design Environment application. The CIW logs the design session and reports messages.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII

ITEM.NAME: Constraint Manager
ITEM.DESC: Dockable assistant pane in the Virtuoso software that defines, manages, and transfers constraints throughout the custom IC design flow. Used to define constraints that affect design elements such as nets, instances, devices, parameterized cells (pcells), and ROD objects.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: CPF
ITEM.DESC: (Common Power Format) ASCII file that specifies the power intent that is used throughout the implementation and verification of a design. Different tools utilize different parts of the specification.

ITEM.NAME: CV
ITEM.DESC: Constraint Validation
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: DFM
ITEM.DESC: Design For Manufacturing
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: DUT
ITEM.DESC: (Design Under Test) Portion of the simulation that is synthesized. The other portion of the simulation could be referred to as the test bench.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: EAD
ITEM.DESC: Electrically Aware Design

ITEM.NAME: iterated instances
ITEM.DESC: Compact way of displaying repeated instances of a symbol in a schematic, particularly useful in bus-type or data-flow architectures that have identical structures to handle each bit on the bus. To add several instances of the same type, you can express multiple unique names with an iterative expression. For example, A0:3; generates one graphic representing four instances: A0, A1, A2, and A3.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: library name
ITEM.DESC: Name of the library where the cellview is located.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: OSS netlister
ITEM.DESC: Creates a single netlist of the entire design hierarchy in the netlist directory. The OSS netlister uses spectre simInfo. You do not need to add ams simInfo or convert PDKs (as you do if you use the cellview-based netlister).

ITEM.NAME: Pcell
ITEM.DESC: (Parameterized Cell) A graphic, programmable cell that lets you create a customized instance each time you place it.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: PDK
ITEM.DESC: (Process Design Kit) Developed by PDK team for certain technology. It contains rule deck, techfiles, library cells

ITEM.NAME: PSF
ITEM.DESC: (Parameter Storage Format) When the AMS Designer simulator runs standalone, it writes the results of the AC analysis to a parameter storage format (PSF) file. By default, the software stores the PSF file in a directory called ascf.raw (where ascf is the name of the analog simulation control file).

ITEM.NAME: Results Browser
ITEM.DESC: Assistant in the Virtuoso Visualization and Analysis XL window that is used to open the stored simulation results. Results Browser displays simulation results (signals) in a hierarchical arrangement that corresponds to the hierarchy of your design, making it easy for you to locate and manage simulation data.

ITEM.NAME: schematic cellview
ITEM.DESC: Describes the connectivity, gate widths, and gate lengths of transistors.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: SMG
ITEM.DESC: (Schematic Model Generation) Creates behavioral models from interconnected and configured building block instances on a schematic.

ITEM.NAME: state
ITEM.DESC: ADE L setup information is saved as a state file.

ITEM.NAME: view name
ITEM.DESC: Name of the current cellview. The view name is user defined. Different views can be used to represent different levels of abstraction of a design (behavior, gate) or different stages in the design process (rtl, postsynthesis). Views can also be used to contain different types of data about a cell (schematic, symbol, layout, vhdl).
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: workspace
ITEM.DESC: Arrangement of various assistants and the window settings that you specify while working with a graph.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Spectre,Virtuoso Layout Suite,VSE,DFII,non-DFII,Cadence Shared Tools,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: MVRC
ITEM.DESC: Multi-Voltage Rule Checker (Synopsys product)

ITEM.NAME: PIEA
ITEM.DESC: Power Intent Export Assistant, Virtuoso

ITEM.NAME: VSE SMG Model Schematic Application
ITEM.DESC: VSE SMG Model Schematic Application optimizes the standard VSE tool for use with SMG. SMG uses VSE as a canvas to define the design behavior, and consequently, the behavior of the models to be created by placing, connecting, and configuring SMG building blocks (BBTs).

ITEM.NAME: SMG Model Schematic
ITEM.DESC: SMG model schematic is the schematic created to represent the behavioral model graphically.

ITEM.NAME: SMG IP Information Viewer
ITEM.DESC: SMG IP Information Viewer is used to describe the IP information for the current IP in use, such as a model schematic. It contains some basic information of an IP, such as name, description, filter tags, model format tags, aliases, pins, parameters, and so on.

ITEM.NAME: smgIpInfo view
ITEM.DESC: SMG IP Information View describes the IP information for the current IP in use, such as a model schematic. It contains some basic information of an IP, such as name, description, filter tags, model format tags, aliases, pins, parameters, and so on.

ITEM.NAME: Navigator
ITEM.DESC: The Navigator is a dockable/undockable assistant pane that provides facilities to view objects across the design hierarchy using a tree representation.

ITEM.NAME: Probes Assistant
ITEM.DESC: The Probes Assistant is a dockable/undockable assistant pane that provides facilities to view the probed nets across the design hierarchy.

ITEM.NAME: text cellview
ITEM.DESC: A text-based cellview, like Verilog, SystemVerilog, VHDL, among others that you can import and create in Virtuoso. You can edit text cellviews using Virtuoso Text Editor. You can also create their symbol views and databases.

ITEM.NAME: Transparent layout hierarchy
ITEM.DESC: Transparent layout hierarchy is the layout hierarchy other than the top-level hierarchy, which does not match the schematic hierarchy, but the binder can still bind to the instances within it.

ITEM.NAME: Component type
ITEM.DESC: A component type is the name given to that classification of layout cells which share common characteristics.

ITEM.NAME: Abutment
ITEM.DESC: Abutment is the process of allowing cells to be automatically overlapped, aligned, and electrically connected without introducing a design rule violation or connectivity error.

ITEM.NAME: Instance array
ITEM.DESC: An array of ungrouped instances that is generated based on row or column values and the spacing values that you specify.

ITEM.NAME: Modgen
ITEM.DESC: An array of instances that are grouped in a modgen constraint and have same or different connectivity and masters.

ITEM.NAME: Mosaic
ITEM.DESC: A compact array of instances that belong to the same mfactored instance and, therefore, have the same master and connectivity.

ITEM.NAME: Cloning
ITEM.DESC: Cloning is the ability to replicate a section of the layout, associated with a section of the schematic, in such a way that the new piece of layout material can be placed at more than one location, with each part preserving the hierarchical structure of the design. Cloning differs from synchronous copying in that the cloned structure maintains its schematic correspondence and inherits the connectivity information, while a synchronous copy does not maintain any schematic correspondence.

ITEM.NAME: Synchronized Clone Family
ITEM.DESC: If the clone source is selected from the layout cellview in which the clone target is generated, the clone source and the clone target are gathered in a common clone family, and the generated clones so formed are called synchronized clones because they are synchronized to the other members in the clone family.

ITEM.NAME: Synchronous clones
ITEM.DESC: Synchronous clones are the clones that stay synchronized during editing, changes made to one member of a family are automatically reflected in all the other members of the clone family.

ITEM.NAME: Dummy instances
ITEM.DESC: Instances that are created in the layout to counter electrical effects that are observed at small geometries. These instances get their connectivity from the layout net to which they are tied.

ITEM.NAME: Active dummy instances
ITEM.DESC: Dummy instances that are connected to a net other than the power or ground net.

ITEM.NAME: Inactive dummy instances
ITEM.DESC: Dummy instances that are connected to a power or ground net.

ITEM.NAME: VPLGens
ITEM.DESC: VPLGens (Virtuoso parameterized layout generators) are Cadence-supported hierarchical pcells that require no SKILL coding and can be edited using all the standard Virtuoso tools, including Layout XL, floorplanner, automatic placers, routers, and so on.

ITEM.NAME: Pseudoparallel connection
ITEM.DESC: A pseudoparallel connection is defined as a group of instance terminals on a net that are at the same voltage, due to which they do not need a physical connection.
ITEM.TOOLS: Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: Pin permutation
ITEM.DESC: Pin permutation is the Layout XL operation that allows you to exchange the connectivity or net connections of the pins of a component.

ITEM.NAME: flight line
ITEM.DESC: The lines that Layout XL draws on the canvas to show incomplete electrical connections between the devices on each net.

ITEM.NAME: Smart Display
ITEM.DESC: (SMD) Smart Display is a layout editing environment that can be used to generate a symbolic representation of the layout by using one of the two modes, Abstracted or Schematic.

ITEM.NAME: Virtual connections
ITEM.DESC: Virtual connections are logical electrical connections between sets of physically connected shapes.

ITEM.NAME: Attached Label
ITEM.DESC: Label (oaText) attached to a shape in the edited cellview.

ITEM.NAME: Stamp Label
ITEM.DESC:
Stamp Label
Label (oaText) stamping a shape either in the edited cellview or in the hierarchy. For a label to stamp a shape, the origin of the label must overlap the shape. In addition, in the technology file stampLabelLayers rule, the stamp layer must be defined as stamping the shape layer-purpose pair.

ITEM.NAME: Virtual-connect label
ITEM.DESC: Label (oaText) that has the specific syntax to tag shapes as virtually connected. By default, for a label to be recognized as a virtual-connect label, the label must have the virtual-connect separator, (:).

ITEM.NAME: Markers
ITEM.DESC: Markers are flashing boxes in the layout canvas that indicate electrical shorts or invalid overlaps.
ITEM.TOOLS: Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: Probing
ITEM.DESC: Probing is the Layout XL functionality that lets you select an instance, net, or pin in the layout or schematic window to highlight the corresponding element in the other window.

ITEM.NAME: LAM
ITEM.DESC: The Library and Attributes Mapping (LAM) file stores the symbol properties that drive layout generation, component type information for a given library, and library and cell-level mapping information.

ITEM.NAME: Virtuoso ADE Explorer
ITEM.DESC: The Virtuoso ADE Explorer provides a single-testbench platform that can be used to define the simulation settings and run simulations based on the specified settings.

ITEM.NAME: RTT
ITEM.DESC: The Real-Time Tuning assistant in ADE Explorer is used to edit the values of variables and parameters and the simulation results are dynamically updated to reflect the changes that have been made.

ITEM.NAME: Monte Carlo analysis
ITEM.DESC: Analysis used to estimate parametric yields and generate information about the performance characteristics of the circuits you design.

ITEM.NAME: Waveform Info-Balloons
ITEM.DESC: Waveform info-balloons or thumbnails are used to view the output waveforms in the schematic design.

ITEM.NAME: Graph Marker
ITEM.DESC: The marker attaches a description to a point on the graph. The default label for a marker displays the X and Y coordinates of its intersection with the trace or the coordinates of the point location of the marker.

ITEM.NAME: Transient Measurement
ITEM.DESC: The Transient Measurement is an assistant used to display the calculated measurements for the transient markers on specific edges. The measurements can be falltime, risetime, overshoot, undershoot, and slewrate values.

ITEM.NAME: touchstone file
ITEM.DESC: The touchstone file is an ASCII file, also known as the SnP file, which includes a large signals S-parameter results. The touchstone files are of .snp extension, where n is the number of network ports of the device.

ITEM.NAME: VCSV
ITEM.DESC: The ViVA Comma-Separated Format format can be used to save the traces that can be loaded from within the Virtuoso Visualization and Analysis XL tool for use in the future.

ITEM.NAME: csv
ITEM.DESC: Comma-Separated Format

ITEM.NAME: dft
ITEM.DESC: Discrete Fourier Transform. Computes the discrete Fourier transform of the Fourier Transform of a signal.

ITEM.NAME: dftbb
ITEM.DESC:
Discrete Fourier Transform Baseband
Computes the Discrete Fourier Transform (fast Fourier transform) of a complex signal.

ITEM.NAME: DNL
ITEM.DESC:
Differential Non-Linearity
Computes the differential non-linearity of a transient simple or parametric waveform.

ITEM.NAME: ADE Assembler
ITEM.DESC: An interactive, multi-test environment that you can use to configure and run simulations for multiple tests.

ITEM.NAME: parametric set
ITEM.DESC: A parametric set contains all possible sweep combinations by pairing each value of a variable or parameter with all values of the other variables or parameters

ITEM.NAME: Run Plan
ITEM.DESC: Run Plan in ADE Assembler provides the capability to create multiple variations of the setup within a single session, where each run has its own setup details that override the settings in the active setup.

ITEM.NAME: Circuit checks
ITEM.DESC: Checks that enable you to analyze typical design problems, such as high impedance nodes, leakage paths between power supplies, timing errors, power issues, connectivity problems, or extreme rise and fall times.

ITEM.NAME: Asserts
ITEM.DESC: Device checks that are used to perform checks on design parameters, node voltages, element currents, model parameters, operating point parameters, and expressions

ITEM.NAME: SPD
ITEM.DESC: (Symbolic Placement of Devices) SPD is an assisted, row-based placer with symbolic P/N device representation to improve productivity of layout designers.

ITEM.NAME: Virtuoso ADE Verifier
ITEM.DESC: A Virtuoso application to perform requirements-driven verification of analog designs.

ITEM.NAME: verifier cellview
ITEM.DESC: A cellview that stores the necessary data of an analog design verification project managed using Virtuoso ADE Verifier. This cellview contains the requirements hierarchy and details, implementation links, and mapping between the requirements and their corresponding implementations. It also stores the Verifier settings for the project.

ITEM.NAME: database
ITEM.DESC: The database of instances, nets, and pins in a text cellview that can create from Virtuoso Text Editor. Depending on the cellview text file, the editor uses the appropriate parser to generate the database. For example, to parse a Verilog, Verilog-AMS, or SystemVerilog file, the editor uses the Native Code Verilog compiler (ncvlog). The database information is stored in the netlist.oa and data.dm files within the directory structure of the text cellview.

ITEM.NAME: OSS
ITEM.DESC: Open Simulation System (OSS) provides access to the simulators that it supports and lets you integrate and customize new simulators into the Virtuoso design environment. OSS also lets you customize hierarchical netlister (HNL), HNL net-based netlister, flat netlister (FNL), and post layout simulation.

ITEM.NAME: mapping requirements
ITEM.DESC: The mapping between a requirement and its corresponding implementation. Also see Implementation and Requirement.

ITEM.NAME: Verification plan
ITEM.DESC: See Requirements
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Virtuoso Analog Design Environment,Virtuoso AMS Environment,AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: verification requirements
ITEM.DESC: A design verification plan, also referred to as a requirements hierarchy, includes a set of hierarchy of verification requirements. A verification requirement is an abstract description of an aspect of a design that needs to be verified, along with its details. It includes details like the title, description, and verification type with the applicable range of acceptable output values. In a multi-user design environment, requirements can have owners.

ITEM.NAME: implementations
ITEM.DESC: An implementation represents the actual simulation setup, testbench, and the measured output of a requirement. Implementation data is stored in a cellview, namely a maestro cellview. You can map an implementation to a corresponding requirement. To determine the status of a mapped requirement, you run the implementation cellview. The relevant results are compared to the specification values set in the related implementations or requirement.

ITEM.NAME: palsdir
ITEM.DESC: The internal name for the Verifier database that is also referred to as the run summary data.

ITEM.NAME: config.xml
ITEM.DESC: A user-interface configuration file used to create new custom constraint types, override definitions of existing custom constraint types, and extend definitions of any system constraint type.

ITEM.NAME: GenericModgen constraint
ITEM.DESC: A modgen constraint that is created as a template whose parameters can be edited directly without launching the Modgen Editor.

ITEM.NAME: MPT
ITEM.DESC: Multi-Patterning Technology (MPT) is used for advanced nodes with more than one lithography mask for one or more layers. Virtuoso uses different colors for the masks on a layer for easy visualization.

ITEM.NAME: HCL
ITEM.DESC: Hierarchical Color Locking (HCL) is a method for locking the color of hierarchical shapes.
ITEM.TOOLS: Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: Electromigration
ITEM.DESC: A term used to describe the movement of atoms in a solid conductor resulting from collisions between the flow of electrons and metal atoms in connecting wires.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: Electromigration checking
ITEM.DESC: (EM checking) To analyze the power grid and signals of the design for any density violations of the DC and AC current through the metal conductor lines, vias, and contacts. These violations can then be corrected by limiting current density in the affected areas of the design.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: Electromigration check (EM check)
ITEM.DESC: A check to be run on a design using the dataset to identify EM violations.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: dataset
ITEM.DESC: A repository where the current or voltage data extracted from simulation results is saved. This dataset is referred in the EAD flow for EM checking.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: EAD technology file
ITEM.DESC: A binary encrypted file that contains electrical process parameters for RC extraction, halo distances, capacitance models, and the electromigration rules.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: eadmodelGen
ITEM.DESC: A utility to generate an EAD technology file. The executable for this is available under $CDSHOME/tools/catena/bin in the Virtuoso installation area.
ITEM.TOOLS: ADE,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: DM
ITEM.DESC: Data Management

ITEM.NAME: dag
ITEM.DESC: Directed Acyclic Graph

ITEM.NAME: DLIST
ITEM.DESC: Display List

ITEM.NAME: DPT
ITEM.DESC: Double Patterning Technology (DPT) is MPT with only two lithography masks for one or more layers.

ITEM.NAME: WSP
ITEM.DESC: Width spacing pattern (WSP) is an advanced form of snap pattern that defines tracks as width and spacing pairs on which shapes can be placed.

ITEM.NAME: track
ITEM.DESC: Horizontal and vertical gridlines on which shapes can be placed.

ITEM.NAME: taper
ITEM.DESC: Special wiring needed for connecting to pins due to one of the following conditions: the net wire is wider than the pin, vias for the net would cause a DRC violation when accessing the pin, or spacing conditions cannot be met in the pin area because the pins are too close together.
ITEM.TOOLS: Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: shield
ITEM.DESC: A wire above, below, or adjacent to a signal wire that is added to improve the signal integrity.

ITEM.NAME: interconnect
ITEM.DESC: Collection of structures that propagate signals between the pins of cell instances and/or top-level pins. Interconnect does not include the structures that occur as part of the fixed layout of a cell.

ITEM.NAME: wire
ITEM.DESC: A collection of one or more wire segments or pathSegs. By extension, a wire may consist of several pathSegs and vias physically connecting them together.

ITEM.NAME: net
ITEM.DESC: Two or more pins that need to be connected and includes both the geometric and logical descriptions. It generally refers to the nets described in the NETS section in a DEF file.

ITEM.NAME: via
ITEM.DESC: It is just a hole into the oxide layer which connects the two different metal layers

ITEM.NAME: via stack
ITEM.DESC: Physically stacking vias belonging to adjacent layers on top of each other.

ITEM.NAME: wire stack
ITEM.DESC: Physically stacking wires belonging to adjacent layers on top of each other.

ITEM.NAME: smart snapping
ITEM.DESC: When an wire goes near the pin, the object is attracted to the pin edge and the wire starts automatically with the width of the pin edge.

ITEM.NAME: trackPatterns
ITEM.DESC: Uniformly-spaced orthogonal patterns extending across the base array. The tracks that make up the track pattern provide guidelines for laying interconnect routes. Gridded routers place the center-line of each route collinear with an unused segment of a routing track.

ITEM.NAME: path
ITEM.DESC: An object made of several metal segments of the same width.

ITEM.NAME: pathSeg
ITEM.DESC: A physical description of a metal segment of a net. It includes the physical location, layer, and width of the wire segment.

ITEM.NAME: spine
ITEM.DESC: A collection of connected pathsegs sharing the same layer and width but different direction. Also, there is exactly one and only one pathseg connected to any pathseg end and start point, that is there is no T-junction.

ITEM.NAME: split
ITEM.DESC: Lets you split and stretch a portion of an object. It is usually used to add a jog by stretching a section of a wire or group of wires (a bus).

ITEM.NAME: control wire
ITEM.DESC: In the set of multiple wires (a bus), one of the wire segments stands out as being the probed/highlighted wire segment with a small yellow box at the end of the wire segment. This is called as the control wire. The other bits of the bus are derived and computed from the control wire.

ITEM.NAME: Assisted routing commands
ITEM.DESC: Virtuoso level commands, such as Point to Point routing, Guided routing, Finish Wire, Finish Bus, and Finish Trunk, which embed the automatic routing engines from Virtuoso Space-based router.

ITEM.NAME: trunk
ITEM.DESC: A wire to which all pins of cell instances are connected to. It is usually implemented as horizontal pathseg between two rows of n/p mos transistors. All transistors gates/sources/drains of that net will connect vertically to the trunk (spine routing).

ITEM.NAME: dynamic display
ITEM.DESC: The ability to dynamically display accessible or valid tracks in interactive routing commands, such as Create Wire, Create Bus, and Stretch. The tracks are displayed based on the current layer-purpose pair, active pattern, minWidth constraints, wireType constraints, and regions.

ITEM.NAME: bus
ITEM.DESC: A bundle of wires on multiple assigned or unassigned nets, usually routed together using the same physical topology.
ITEM.TOOLS: Virtuoso Layout Suite,AMS Enviroment,Virtuoso AMS Environment

ITEM.NAME: Interactive routing commands
ITEM.DESC: Virtuoso level commands, such as Create Wire, Create Bus,Stretch, Split, Edit Bus, used for creating and editing routing interactively.

ITEM.NAME: Specialty routing constraints
ITEM.DESC: Allowing to specify constraints to describe a style of routing. For example, shielding, symmetry, diffpair and matchLength.

ITEM.NAME: Process Rule Overrides
ITEM.DESC: User-defined rules which forces to override a process rule definition. The user defined rule may be defined for a given design or for a specific net or group of nets.

ITEM.NAME: multi-layer bus
ITEM.DESC: The bus-bits that are created and digitized on different metal layers.

ITEM.NAME: digitization
ITEM.DESC: The action of a single click with the left mouse button when using Virtuoso level interactive commands.
ITEM.TOOLS: Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite,Virtuoso Layout Suite

ITEM.NAME: amsDmv
ITEM.DESC: AMS Design and Model Validation
